intro: Suregada lanceolata, commonly known as the lanceleaf suregada, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant features narrow, lance-shaped leaves and produces yellow flowers that bloom in spring. It thrives in well-drained soils and is often found in grassland and rocky habitats. Due to its ornamental value, it is sometimes cultivated in gardens.
